DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04CrowdColaCars_TA: *Hesitant Cheering*
RESPONSE TEXT: Amen.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Gage: All right, all right. Now, get the hell out of here. I'll show the boss around.
SCRIPT NOTES: Projected. Loudly agreeing with his sister. / Irritated

DIALOGUE BEFORE: OperatorsLeader: And that we're going to get back to robbing folks of their fucking money.
RESPONSE TEXT: Great. Another nut--
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: William.
SCRIPT NOTES: You're cut off by your sister, trying to ensure you don't say something stupid to your new boss. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04NPCFMagsBlack: Well. I suppose we all owe you for putting down Colter.
RESPONSE TEXT: Man was an idiot. Made us all look bad.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Regret, I guess. I didn't want to kill him.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Regret, I guess. I didn't want to kill him.
RESPONSE TEXT: You'd be the only one...
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: Agreed. Not going to make much of a splash around Nuka-World with an attitude like that...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Taking down an opponent like that, it's thrilling.
RESPONSE TEXT: Sure looked it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: Hmm. Perhaps you're better suited to this than I expected.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Bored. Kind of like this conversation, now that you mention it...
RESPONSE TEXT: Hey. You don't get to talk to Mags that way.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: It's all right, William.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Well... you, Overboss. You're... an unknown quantity. And we're interested in knowing who we're dealing with.
RESPONSE TEXT: So, we'd like if you answered the question.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: Yes. What went through you as you crushed the life out of that oaf?
SCRIPT NOTES: Curious about the person standing in front of you. Not too aggressive, as this is your boss. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: OperatorsLeader: This is my brother, William.
RESPONSE TEXT: Pleasure.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: Along with our co-conspirator Lizzie, we run this crew. Call ourselves the Operators.
SCRIPT NOTES: Very flat. You're not actually pleased to meet your new boss. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Happiness?
RESPONSE TEXT: Nope.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: Caps. This place was built for the sole purpose of taking caps out of the pockets of fools.
SCRIPT NOTES: Someone just gave an answer you find stupid to a question your sister posed. / Amused

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Soda?
RESPONSE TEXT: Heh. Not quite.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: Caps. This place was built for the sole purpose of taking caps out of the pockets of fools.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: OperatorsLeader: ... though by somewhat more cutthroat methods than I expect its founders intended.
RESPONSE TEXT: Instead Colter had us sitting on our asses for the better part of a year while he lived large in his damn mountaintop.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: And that means if you're going to be in charge around here, we'd like some assurances that you intend to bring this place back to its true purpose.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: My goal's to use this place to make all the money I can.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, it's about damn time.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: Hmm. I look forward to seeing your claims put into action.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm sorry. That sounds like a demand. I'm the Overboss around here. And I'll do whatever the hell I want.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hmm. Of course, boss.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorsLeader: Whatever you say.
SCRIPT NOTES: This is an angry grumble. Your new boss just told your sister to shut her mouth. You're picturing cutting his throat in your head. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We are the only rational players around here and would make valuable allies, so long as we know you intend to get this place back to bringing in caps.
RESPONSE TEXT: So, we want to know what your plan is.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: My goal's to use this place to make all the money I can.
SCRIPT NOTES: Add a little bit of sternness to this. You're talking to your boss, but you're not used to sugar coating your words. / Question

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04MQ05Mags: Looks like Nisha's dug in pretty well up there.
RESPONSE TEXT: I knew that nutjob would turn on us sooner or later. So, are we storming the place or what?
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04MQ05Mason: Think we're about to find out... the boss is here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04MQ05Mags: Looks like Mason's dug in pretty well up there.
RESPONSE TEXT: I knew that nutjob would turn on us sooner or later. So, are we storming the place or what?
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04MQ05Nisha: Both of you shut up. We're about to find out... the boss is here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04MQ05Mags: Which we certainly appreciated. But, surprise, surprise... Nisha wasn't exactly thrilled to hear the news.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah... she and her gang forced their way into the Power Plant. Now they've got the entire place locked down.
She can't get away with this, boss. And we all want in on the action!
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04MQ05Mason: Hey, now. I already lost men trying to stop her.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Amen.
RESPONSE TEXT: Let's do this!
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04MQ05Mason: <Howls>

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04MQ05Mags: We can't let him get away with this, boss. And we all want a crack at those loonies.
RESPONSE TEXT: Damn right we do.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04MQ05Nisha: Look... it's your play. We'll follow you anywhere, but you have to swear to us that Mason pays for this with his life.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04MQ05Mags: Time to clean house.
RESPONSE TEXT: We got your back, boss!
Didn't think the peace between the gangs would end like this. Now Nisha gets to learn what happens to traitors.
Bullet to the brain's too good for Nisha. She deserves a slow death.
Next Disciple I see I'm filling with lead.
Didn't think the peace between the gangs would end like this. Now Mason gets to learn what happens to traitors.
Bullet to the brain's too good for Mason. He deserves a slow death.
Next Pack member I see I'm filling with lead.
The World's yours now, boss.
Never thought I'd see this place lit up again.
Nuka-World back on its feet. I imagine Colter's spinning in his grave right now.
God dammit...
Hmph. W-what else ya got?
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. Through gritted teeth. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Rrgh.
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. Through gritted teeth. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Have to.. have to try harder than that.
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. Through gritted teeth. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Sleep tight.
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening someone in the heat of combat. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Made your own grave.
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening someone in the heat of combat. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Last day you'll ever see.
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening someone in the heat of combat. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: You want to get started?
You're gonna wish you'd run.
Really wanna try me, huh?
Should be a couple odd jobs available if you want to get your hands dirty. Talk to Mags.
SCRIPT NOTES: By "odd jobs" you mean murdering people. Add some smirk to that. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Mags always saw the potential in this place. And she doesn't steer us wrong.
Pack act like rabid animals... ought to be dealt with the same way.
SCRIPT NOTES: Talking about a gang you can't stand. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Any Operator gets caught breaking the peace, I'll punish them myself, boss. Can't let them think it's all right to get caught.
SCRIPT NOTES: Second line should have some smirk on it. Your problem isn't that your people are breaking that peace. Only that they got caught doing it. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Operators got no tolerance for dead weight. Those who can't cut it, they're gone.
Hmm. Our new boss. You're going to want to talk to Mags.
Pack and the Disciples have some screws loose. We're the ones you should be putting stock in.
Bringing this place back from the dead - Operators are the only crew for the job.
You want us on your side? Prove it.
SCRIPT NOTES: Not a threat. A statement of fact. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Colter jerked us all around. Don't make the same mistake he did.
SCRIPT NOTES: Add a bit of threat to the end of this. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Gotta say, I'm more and more pleased you didn't die in the Gauntlet, boss.
SCRIPT NOTES: Talking to your boss, whom you're growing to respect. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Quite the upgrade over Colter, aren't you?
SCRIPT NOTES: Talking to your boss, whom you're growing to respect. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Make yourself at home.
What? You come to finally start making nice?
You look lost. Shouldn't you be out there claiming us a new haunt?
Operators are sick of living off scraps. Time you rethought who you're giving territory to.
Mags said no witnesses. So I left no witnesses.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorRest: Damn.
SCRIPT NOTES: Very nonchalant. Like killing a band of high-end mercenaries is what everyone does. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Don't lend around here. You earn a piece, or you make what you have work.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorRest: Damn.
SCRIPT NOTES: Someone asked if they could borrow one of your weapons. You're saying no. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Heard you've been spotted skimming rations. That ends today... or you're going to.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OperatorRest: Damn.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MagsBlack: So our new Overboss is a vault dweller.
RESPONSE TEXT: Or iced a vault dweller.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MagsBlack: Hmm. You can go.
SCRIPT NOTES: Chiming in to help your sister think through some interesting information. / Neutral
